my scene is mostly white edit young white and college educated im far from an expert on this but going to spew off my opinion anyway i think us culture associate jazz music and swing dancing with old movie ginger rogers fred astaire and theatre jazz music also kindof get lumped in with classical music a not contemporary to be preserved played in middle school and high school band often with a classically trained band director and in some way is associated with the well cultured elite i think some of these cultural thing unrelated to how the swing dance community act have pushed the demographic of swing dancing toward where it is now and once weve got a mostly white community thats going to selfperpetuate some cultural norm from the background of the attendee are going to impact the dance community i think there is a lot of good discussion going on now on what the dance community ha lost and what to try to bring back and ive seen some change that i reminder i have no expertise think are promising but shifting culture is hard understanding what wa changed and how to change it back is incredibly difficult it is easy to mess up without malice and end up coming across a patronizing or judgemental in way that dont help the cause and were fighting headwind that are broader than just our dance community in our culture perception of swing dancing and jazz i dont have solution im hopeful that some of the work people are putting in will pay off in some respect i think that bringing back some cultural norm that were in the dance that were lost to white social norm might make sticking around more appealing to potential black dancer who give it a shot and the dance more fun in general

i think it not just that it white per se  it that swing ha become very middle class in outlook what wa once an africanamerican street dance is now learned mostly from professional instructor in purposebuilt studio for what is for many a fairly hefty price with dance held on a mostly clockwork schedule i think it lost some of the spontaneity of it origin if i had my way id see to it that swing community would bring speaker and music to public space and dance there and more importantly teach any interested bystander some of the basic in other word i think swing need to become a street dance again america in the coming year is going to be fertile ground if the community play it card right you have growing income inequality which make professional lesson and fancy dance harder and harder to afford and a public that craves real human connection after the pandemic we could have a new roaring twenties if were daring enough

i guess maybe start by looking at your local area demographic i know for me living where i do that the population is overwhelmingly white and so it doesnt seem surprising that local event reflect that but if your area is more diverse then that is more interesting i guess

being of both african american and italian heritage ive never felt unwelcome or culturally usurped in my year swing dancing quite the opposite in fact in my experience at my old home scene and visiting several others over the year they were subset of the community they were in be it a college or city in my book it doesnt matter black or white engineer or artist conservative or liberal all were welcome to learn the language of swing dance except pretzelers  my 2 cent in my experience

although i will say the first time i wa honestly belittled and made actually uncomfortable and not in a positive way wa the race discussion at lindy focus in 2017 i thought it wa going to be a combination of history discussion and how do we expand the reach of our scene but instead it wa primarily what i see now a woke indoctrination including the direct belittling of my experience and basically calling everyone who wasnt black a cultural appropriator for being there and even thinking about dancing it wa quite disgusting and really turned me off of the rest of the camp

oh both of my dance scene are super welcoming i dont think one is actively driving a group away i just saw it a a very interesting observation if you had to guesstimate what percentage of your scene would be african american

filipinoamerican albeit half white here  in my experience it mostly middleclass white liberal ive met people of a number of background dancing but thats the core with that said ive rarely if ever felt excluded from anything
